ca.utoronto.msrg.padres.common.comm
Class NodeAddress 

java.lang.Object
  ca.utoronto.msrg.padres.common.comm.NodeAddress
Direct Known Subclasses:
RMIAddress, SocketAddress 
public abstract class NodeAddress
				
extends Object

Author:
Bala Maniymaran Created: 2010-08-11 Base class for managing host URIs of different communication protocols. Every communication protocol has to implement its own address class inherited from this abstract class.

checkFormat

public static boolean checkFormat(String nodeURI)
                           throws CommunicationException
Checks whether a given server URI follows the protocol-specific format

Parameters:
nodeURI - The server URI to be checked for format
Returns:
true if the format is verified correct; false otherwise
Throws:
CommunicationException - if nodeURI communication type is not recognized
See Also:
getMatch(String)

isEqual

public abstract boolean isEqual(String nodeURI)
                         throws CommunicationException
Checks whether a given server URI is functionally same as the URI defined here. A string matching is not enough to verify the functional equivalence. For example, host can be an IP address in one place, while it is the equivalent hostname in the other.

Parameters:
nodeURI - A server URI
Returns:
true if the given URI is functionally the same as the node address here; false otherwise.
Throws:
CommunicationException - When there is an error in parsing the URI or some network-based resolution produces an error message

public int hashCode()
